Journalists in the West Bank face mounting suppression
description: Since October 7, Israel has arrested and imprisoned at least 140 journalists working in this occupied territory, most often under the catch-all charge of 'incitement to terrorism.' The Palestinian Journalists Syndicate has condemned what it describes as a strategy to 'silence' media professionals.

US and China agree to work on extending the deadline for new tariffs in trade talks
description: The latest round of talks opened Monday and concluded Tuesday in Stockholm to try to break a logjam over tariffs that have skewed the pivotal commercial ties between the world's two largest economies.

headline: Suing the state in France: How does this universal right work in practice?
description: Climate, health, femicides: Lawsuits against the state have surged in recent years. Beyond securing compensation for victims, these legal procedures primarily aim to raise public awareness and drive change.

headline: Spike Lee, Benin's star ambassador to attract the Afro-descendant diaspora
description: The American filmmaker and his wife, Tonya Lewis Lee, have been appointed as ambassadors to the diaspora in the United States. The Beninese government has also launched a platform, 'My Afro Origins,' allowing people to apply for Beninese citizenship.

headline: Low-calorie French pastries struggle to win over chefs and consumers
description: While French pastries are renowned worldwide for their refined taste and aesthetic appeal, their nutritional value could place them in the category of junk food. However, some pastry chefs are attempting to create cakes that are lower in sugar and fat.

'In the West Berlin squats, we argued but lived together': Karin Wieland, political rebel
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by artistic performances
description: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she offers suggestions to awaken your creativity and transform your intimate space into the stage for a very unique happening.

headline: Initial tariff impacts painful for auto, textile and chemical industries
description: Six months after Donald Trump introduced the first US tariffs, companies have started to feel the effects of a shock whose repercussions, though they have been contained for now, are likely to be long-lasting.
